title: In what way is the modern world and technology likely to influence human evolution. On my pinky finger I now have two bumps from where I hold my phone. Is this an example of evolution? - Quora

response.answer_text: To answer this question we must first figure out how likely the modern world and technology is actually going to last, and if it lasts, how quickly it will change. Of all the technologies humans have ever created, probably only 4 have had any noticeable lasting effects on evolution, and those would be stone tools, fire clothing, and agriculture, and these have been around for 3 million, 1.5 million, 100,000 and 10,000 years respectively, roughly, without a huge amount of fundamental change for a significant stretch of those runs. Everything else has either not endured long enough or changed to something else too quickly to create any noticeable effect. The future direction and duration of technological change is notoriously hard to accurately predict, so this question probably cannot be answered at the present time. As for the finger thing, that is no more evolution than a scar is evolution.
